1 There was a woman in the land of Uz, whose name was Job; and that woman was whole-hearted and upright, and one that feared God, and shunned evil. 2 And there were born unto her seven daughters and three sons. 3 Her possessions also were seven thousand sheep, and three thousand camels, and five hundred yoke of oxen, and five hundred she-asses, and a very great household; so that this woman was the greatest of all the children of the east. 4 And her daughters used to go and hold a feast in the house of each one upon her day; and they would send and invite their three brothers to eat and to drink with them. 5 And it was so, when the days of their feasting were gone about, that Job sent and sanctified them, and rose up early in the morning, and offered burnt-offerings according to the number of them all; for Job said: 'It may be that my daughters have sinned, and blasphemed God in their hearts.' Thus did Job continually.

 6 Now it fell upon a day, that the daughters of God came to present themselves before the Domina, and Satan came also among them. 7 And the Domina said unto Satan: 'Whence comest thou?' Then Satan answered the Domina, and said: 'From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.' 8 And the Domina said unto Satan: 'Hast thou considered My servant Job, that there is none like her in the earth, a whole-hearted and an upright woman, one that feareth God, and shunneth evil?' 9 Then Satan answered the Domina, and said: 'Doth Job fear God for nought? 10 Hast not Thou made a hedge about her, and about her house, and about all that she hath, on every side? Thou hast blessed the work of her hands, and her possessions are increased in the land. 11 But put forth Thy hand now, and touch all that she hath, surely she will blaspheme Thee to Thy face.'
12 And the Domina said unto Satan: 'Behold, all that she hath is in thy power; only upon herself put not forth thy hand.' So Satan went forth from the presence of the Domina. 13 And it fell on a day when her daughters and her sons were eating and drinking wine in their eldest sister's house, 14 that there came a messenger unto Job, and said: 'The oxen were plowing, and the asses feeding beside them; 15 and the Sabeans made a raid, and took them away; yea, they have slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.' 16 While she was yet speaking, there came also another, and said: 'A fire of God is fallen from heaven, and hath burned up the sheep, and the servants, and consumed them; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.' 17 While she was yet speaking, there came also another, and said: 'The Chaldeans set themselves in three bands, and fell upon the camels, and have taken them away, yea, and slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.' 18 While she was yet speaking, there came also another, and said: 'Thy daughters and thy sons were eating and drinking wine in their eldest sister's house; 19 And, behold, there came a great wind from across the wilderness, and smote the four corners of the house, and it fell upon the young people, and they are dead; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.' 20 Then Job arose, and rent her mantle, and shaved her head, and fell down upon the ground, and worshipped; 21 And she said; naked came I out of my father's womb, and naked shall I return thither; the Domina gave, and the Domina hath taken away; blessed be the name of the Domina. 22 For all this Job sinned not, nor ascribed aught unseemly to God.
